definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Cup your hands under the neck and lift the head, allowing the neck to stretch.
sentences.chinese: 手掌放在颈部并托起脑袋，让颈子得到伸展。

sentences.english: Eponine burst out laughing, and threw herself on his neck.
sentences.chinese: 爱潘妮笑了出来，跳上去抱住他的颈子。

sentences.english: And she caught her father round the neck again.
sentences.chinese: 她又抱紧她父亲的颈子。

sentences.english: The necklace was no longer round her neck!
sentences.chinese: 原来颈子上的项链不见了。

sentences.english: His heart was filled with sadness, and he put his arms around the cow's neck.
sentences.chinese: 他心中悲伤逾恒，用双臂紧抱着她的颈子。

sentences.english: Shasta strolled over to it and patted its neck.
sentences.chinese: 沙斯塔踅过去，拍拍马儿的颈子。
